TopicTitle: Speak like a Brit Mk II

Articles.Content: I'll go n' teach those ruffians a lesson that they'll never forget! *loads musket* Actually, a round of fisticuffs may be in the workings.
Well, then! That cyberpunk party last night was some horribly devilish fiasco. Just white noise was all it was, and those hooligans wouldn't know real music if it bloody kicked their bollocks!
G'night chaps and chapettes

*walks in as Cyborg*

I must say I think I look absolutely spiffing! I do love this marvelous blue color. Oh, I apologize, was I interrupting?
yes .
Well, then! How rude of myself! Allow me to fetch you a quick cup of tea as compensation.
I say, this appears to be empty, what what.

Quite so! It's also completely filthy.

*brushes cobwebs off chair*

Would it kill the poor sods to clean this bloody place?
I would good sir, but i just spent my last Quid on a box of ale. *Takes a swig of Beer*
Dear, me... I appear to have woken up in a corner. Dear lord there are a lot of cobwebs here. Where is that maid sod!? Why can't I move!? I need my bloody tea I say!
I say dear sirs, wouldn't is appear that we're a tad bit underpopulated on this thread?

Indeed it is! Perhaps it has something to do with the whole jolly stereotype gubbins. Or the fact that no one's idea of a jolly good time is a rebar wielding cyborg. I say, Would you like a cup of tea sir?
*throws brick through window* OI Come ouer ere! I ave a bone to pick wit you! *takes a big drink of beer* eah tats rite I'm gonna set fire to yer ouse!
You bloody twonkers. I've got LODS OF EMONE IN ME SLACKS!
I must say good chap, I have almost no idea about British! I'll watch lots of gamechap jolly good fellow!
well i say you would be suprised to know that us jolly brits generally dont speak like this you plonker

i say! do you jolly mind if i join you for some tea? *sips tea* ahh marva- *Mirror Universe Ego kicks in* well i do say so fellyos that that was quite unplesant. any of you chaps up for a duel i say??
I say, what a grand idea! 'Ave you got a saber or do we 'ave to go buy some swords down at the pub?
yes fellow i do say so that I do have here jolly good saber you know!

Ah, I remember when I was the champion at the good 'ol sport of Fencing. The French have very peculiar sports indeed.

(BTW, I really did take fencing. You learn to love the taste of water after a while)

As canny good as yee are trying, yee aal fail te realise tha ne-one in Britain speaks leik they're frem the fifties, an not aal Brits hev a southern accent. Ah mesel am a Geordie frem The Toon an there is nothin betta than confusing horf the world wi me accent. Dyer knaa what Ah mean? Probably not.
What the bugger is this ruffian doing here? Such filth and rudeness, I say! Leon, will you show this man the door?

Actually, Geordie is a direct continuation of the Anglo-Saxon settlers of the region. My accent is therefore older than modern English, however if you would like, I could speak in Shakespeare's language if you prefer.
I say, good man, please leave these premises or I will be forced to release the hunting dogs!
Why the dogs? Have my rebar, sir. I trust you'll know what to do with it.
